sentence.text: Bardet-Biedl Syndrome (BBS) is a rare multi-systemic disease with autosomal recessive transmission.

Currently, 21 genes (BBS1-21) present on different chromosomes have been mapped: these genes are responsible for BBS phenotypes and they show a great heterogeneity of mutations.The most common genes are BBS1 (locus 11q13) and BBS10.We show here the case of a 50 year old patient with BBS.
